intro: Trachyphrynium muricatum, commonly known as the roughleaf arrowroot, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its broad, arrowhead-shaped leaves with a rough, textured surface. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spadices, a common feature among arum family members. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and as a starch source. Trachyphrynium muricatum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests.
